medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever, cough, respiratory distress, and chest pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began 8 days before admission with cough, red and watery eyes, and a temperature of 37.2°C. After 2 days, he experienced vomiting and increased lethargy, with a temperature rising to 38.9°C. On examination by his pediatrician, his temperature was 39.4°C, with erythema in the right periorbital region and enlarged cervical lymph nodes. Shortness of breath and tachypnea developed the day following this visit. Despite a diagnosis of acute otitis media and treatment with azithromycin, his cough and occasional vomiting persisted. By the morning of admission, his cough had worsened, along with midsternal chest pain during deep inspiration and a reported weight loss of 1.8 kg in one week. Upon admission, his temperature was 40.3°C, and he showed signs of respiratory distress.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Episodes of streptococcal pharyngitis (five occasions), otitis media (three occasions), and cellulitis (four occasions, the last caused by MRSA). He had had lymphopenia that resolved spontaneously, and had attention deficit–hyperactivity disorder, and a history of molluscum contagiosum.
medical_history.family_history: Mother and sister are carriers of cystic fibrosis; maternal aunt had environmental allergies; paternal aunt had rheumatoid arthritis. No consanguinity in parents.
medical_history.social_history: Lived with parents, a sibling, two dogs (one with roundworm infection), a cat, and a snake. Recent mold noted in the basement of the home, which had been treated for lice. Father works in construction and smokes in the home. Patient had been exposed to relatives with pneumonia 1 month prior.
